resources:
to respect and approve of someone or their behaviour: to love someone very much, especially in a way that shows a lot of admiration or respect, or to like something very much: a high-level competition to decide who is the best, especially in a sport: to get and keep things of one type such as stamps or coins as a hobby: to (cause to) exist together, or join together to make a single thing or group: an agreement or an arrangement, especially in business: very serious or bad: are protective padded gear worn on the elbows to protect them against injury during a fall or a strike: to behave in a silly way, especially in a way that might have dangerous results: very interested, eager, or wanting (to do) something very much: //сомнительно communicating with someone, usually because they do not live near you now: having the most recent information, or using the newest methods or tools: a good understanding of someone and an ability to communicate well with them: stupid or unreasonable and deserving to be laughed at: happening soon:
to hate a way of behaving or thinking, often because you think it is not moral: to find someone or something attractive and pleasant to look at: to love someone very much, especially in a way that shows a lot of admiration or respect, or to like something very much: to accept, tolerate, or endure something, especially something unpleasant: If something is believable, it seems possible, real, or true: a product that is extremely popular and has sold in very large numbers: to hate someone or something very much: to not have the same opinion, idea, etc.: completely: to give an answer to a particular question when you do not have all the facts and so cannot be certain if you are correct: a book that has stiff covers: very, to a large degree, or at a high level: impossible, or very difficult, to believe: very interested, eager, or wanting (to do) something very much: //сомнительно to hate someone or something:
the story with love: mentally ill, or unable to behave in a reasonable way: the part of a person that makes it possible for him or her to think, feel emotions, and understand things: something strange or not known that has not yet been explained or understood: a long printed story about imaginary characters and events: in a way that is easy to understand or see: to like, choose, or want one thing rather than another: a book of facts, such as a dictionary or an encyclopedia, that you look at to discover particular information: to answer: a film or television programme about love that is intended to make you laugh to appear to be: a person who secretly collects and reports information about the activities of another country or organization: certain; without any doubt: to get rid of something you do not want any more: showing things and people as they really are, or seeming to be real:
general agreement that something is satisfactory or right, or that someone should be included in a group: (of clothes) hanging loosely because of being too big or having been stretched: to get and keep things of one type such as stamps or coins as a hobby: to (cause to) exist together, or join together to make a single thing or group: causing disagreement or discussion: an illness, injury, or condition that makes it difficult for someone to do the things that other people do: Something that is distinctive is easy to recognize because it is different from other things: to get free from something, or to avoid something: to behave in a silly way, especially in a way that might have dangerous results: part of a piece of clothing that can be pulled up to cover the top and back of the head: unfriendly and not liking something: who a person is, or the qualities of a person or group that make them different from others: the basic systems and services, such as transport and power supplies, that a country or organization uses in order to work effectively: the fact that something is not available or that there is not enough of it: the state of belonging to an organization:
a small piece of material sewn or stuck over something to cover it: to come to an opinion about something, or have a belief about something: to behave as if something is true when you know that it is not, especially in order to deceive people or as a game: a large, noisy, uncontrolled group of people: to bring the memory of a past event into your mind, and often to give a description of what you remember: to understand a situation or someone\'s feelings because you have experienced a similar situation or similar feelings: to be able to bring back a piece of information into your mind, or to keep a piece of information in your memory: to make someone think of something they have forgotten or might have forgotten: (of clothes or fabric) badly torn: a person who someone admires and whose behaviour they try to copy: made with metal studs fixed into the surface in a pattern: a person whose job is to supervise someone or something: a group of two or more countries that work together or that have the same government: If things of the same type vary, they are different from each other, and if you vary them, you cause them to be different from each other: done, made, or given willingly, without being forced or paid to do it:
to give permission for someone to do something, or to not prevent something from happening: to risk money on the result of an event or a competition, such as a horse race, in the hope of winning more money: the organ inside the head that controls thought, memory, feelings, and activity: to share information with others by speaking, writing, moving your body, or using other signals: a line on a computer screen that moves to show the point where work is being done: a decision or arrangement between groups or people: a choice that you make about something after thinking about several possibilities: to operate a phone or make a phone call to someone by choosing a particular series of numbers on the phone: in the end, especially after a long time or a lot of effort, problems, etc.: exploding or able to explode easily: extremely interesting: to repair something: to stop working especially because of not having electricity: to wait, esp. for someone to speak: to communicate with or react to:
to continue to talk to or write to someone: to stay informed about the most recent trends or developments: to continue for a period of time, or to continue to exist: to think about something that happened in the past: a book that gives you practical instructions on how to do something or how to use something, such as a machine: (used to add information) also and more importantly: not operating because it is broken: to become connected to a piece of electrical equipment or to the main electricity supply: to practise a play, a piece of music, etc. in order to prepare it for public performance: a person, group, etc. competing with others for the same thing or in the same area: the way in which things are organized or arranged: to cause something that is thin to break suddenly and quickly with a cracking sound: the part of a piece of equipment, especially electrical equipment, into which another part fits: to send someone a text message by phone: a phone message recorded by someone when you do not answer their call, or a number of these messages:
to make someone feel worried or upset: abruptly stop talking: you secretly have a sexual relationship with someone else: feeling that you have no hope and are ready to do anything to change the bad situation you are in: (a feeling of) not being certain about something, especially about how good or true it is: to cause someone to become very angry: they agree with each other: annoyed or disgusted by something that you have experienced for too long: for all time: (a situation causing) difficulty or trouble: feelings of great sadness or disappointment: to say or write something that is not true in order to deceive someone: cease to be in communication: to forgive someone and be friendly with them again after an argument or disagreement: correspond or cause to correspond in some essential respect: //сомнительно
their moods change suddenly and they become angry or unhappy easily: only considering one opinion in an argument in a way that is unfair: to cause someone to feel sudden strong emotion: a good understanding of someone and an ability to communicate well with them: to stay in the same place or in the same condition: to force someone or something to stop moving towards you or attacking you: something given in exchange for good behaviour or good work, etc.: stupid or unreasonable and deserving to be laughed at: a usual or fixed way of doing things: in a way or by some means that is not known or not stated: happening in a smooth, gradual, and regular way, not suddenly or unexpectedly: very much or in a very serious way: to tell someone that you will kill or hurt them or cause problems if they do not do what you want: likely to deceive people: used to say that something is sad, disappointing, or has a bad effect:
the skill or sport of shooting arrows is a motorsport involving the racing of automobiles for competition the sport of jumping off a very high bridge, with a long elastic rope tied to your legs, so that the rope pulls you back before you hit the ground a high-level competition to decide who is the best, especially in a sport: are protective padded gear worn on the elbows to protect them against injury during a fall or a strike: to help someone to feel confident and able to do something, or to give advice to someone to do something: the sport of fighting with long, thin swords: a part of a fence or outside wall that is fixed at one side and opens and closes like a door, usually made of metal or wooden strips to stop trying to do something before you have finished, usually because it is too difficult: a tool consisting of a piece of metal with a flat end that is fixed onto the end of a long, thin, usually wooden handle, used for hitting things the activity of flying through the air by hanging from a very small aircraft without an engine, consisting of a frame covered in cloth: a strong, hard hat that covers and protects the head: a long walk, especially in the countryside a game played on ice between two teams of eleven players who each have a curved stick with which the player tries to put the puck the activity of using a Jet Ski to travel across water:
the activity of running at a slow, regular speed, especially as a form of exercise: to jump from an aircraft using a: to delay an event and plan or decide that it should happen at a later date or time: to keep someone or something safe from injury, damage, or loss: the sport of climbing on rocks or in mountains: (a piece of) strong, thick string made of long twisted threads: to (cause to) go or do something very quickly: to record the number of points won by competitors: vehicle for traveling over snow and ice pulled by animals, esp. horses: to cause something to move easily over a surface, or to move in this way: a game played between two teams of eleven people, where each team tries to win by kicking a ball into the other team\'s goal happening soon: an occasion when you win a game, competition, election, war, etc. or the fact that you have won: to prepare yourself for a physical activity by doing some gentle exercises and stretches: to have a heaviness of a stated amount, or to measure the heaviness of an object:
an arrangement with a bank to keep your money there and to allow you to take it out when you need to: to be able to buy or do something because you have enough money or time: unable to pay what you owe, and having control of your financial matters given: to find an amount or number using mathematics: a machine, usually in a wall outside a bank, from which you can take money: something, especially money, that is owed to someone else, or the state of owing something: to give money or goods to help a person or organization: to be greater than a number or amount, or to go past an allowed limit: the rate at which the money of one country can be changed for the money of another country an amount of money needed or used to do or buy something; cost: the crime of getting money by deceiving people: a written promise by a company to repair or change a product that develops a fault within a particular period of time: having very little money: to receive money, a house, etc. from someone after they have died: continuing a long time into the future:
to have just enough money to pay for the things that you need unkind or unpleasant: to borrow money to buy a house: they have lent money to you, or in exchange for something they have done for you: income that should have been paid or was expected at an earlier time: an amount of money paid, or the act of paying: a sum of money paid regularly to a person who has retired: to buy something: to take money or property illegally from a place, organization, or person, often using violence: (of a supply of something) be used up: to keep money so that you can buy something with it in the future: not generous, or unwilling to spend money: to give someone who has provided you with a service an extra amount of money to thank them: help given, especially by the state or an organization, to people who need it, especially because they do not have enough money: to take money out of an account:
the person who is on trial in a law court: the act of getting money from people or forcing them to do something by threatening to tell a secret of theirs or to harm them: a matter to be decided by a judge in a law court: to do something illegal or something that is considered wrong: money that is paid to someone in exchange for something that has been lost or damaged or for some problem: to admit that you have done something wrong or something that you feel guilty or bad about: having officially been found guilty of a crime in a law court: illegal activities: someone who commits a crime: one or more reasons for believing that something is or is not true: responsible for breaking a law: physical harm or damage to someone\'s body caused by an accident or an attack: (of a person) not guilty of a particular crime: the action of abducting someone and holding them captive: to harm moral:
an act of attacking someone and stealing their money: the crime of intentionally killing a person: a building where criminals are forced to live as a punishment: a punishment given by a judge in court to a person or organization after they have been found guilty of doing something wrong: a penalty inflicted as retribution for an offence: the crime of stealing from somewhere or someone: to decide and say officially what a punishment will be: not kind or sympathetic; harsh: the act of making someone take part in sexual activities, against their wishes, or without their agreement: driving faster than is allowed in a particular area: to take legal action against a person or organization: to think that someone has committed a crime or done something wrong: to stop either temporarily or permanently, from happening or continuing(sentence): making you feel that something illegal is happening or that something is wrong: a person who sees an event happening, especially a crime or an accident:
to change something, usually slightly, or to cause the characteristics of something to change: close to a particular number or time: the soft grey or black powder that is left after a substance, especially tobacco, coal, or wood, has burned: not less than; at the minimum: to move in a circle, often around something: a flat, brown or black insect sometimes found in the home: a result of a particular action or situation, often one that is bad or not convenient: the act of destroying something, or the fact of being destroyed: (an event that results in) great harm, damage, or death, or serious difficulty: a long period when there is little or no rain: dry dirt in the form of powder that covers surfaces inside a building, or very small dry pieces of soil, sand, or other substances: a sudden violent movement of the earth\'s surface, sometimes causing great damage: an occasion when a volcano explodes, and flames and rocks come out of it; (of a volcano) the act of doing this: to deal with someone when the situation between you is difficult: a situation in which there is not enough of food:
To strike with force; make contact forcefully. A severe tropical storm with strong winds. To eagerly anticipate or await something. Of great importance or significance. The impact of a meteorite on the Earth\'s surface. The seasonal movement of animals from one region to another. In a liquid state due to heat. To happen or take place. A violent and destructive act carried out by terrorists. A potential danger or source of harm. A widespread outbreak of a virus affecting many people. A microscopic infectious agent capable of causing disease. A mountain or hill with a vent through which lava and gases erupt. An instrument or device used for defense or attack. To completely destroy or eliminate.
To expect or look forward to something happening. A small bell that makes a ringing sound. A type of head covering. A joyful song typically sung during the holiday season. A vertical pipe or flue that carries smoke from a fireplace or stove. To make a loud, ringing noise. A performer known for comedic acts and colorful costumes. Small pieces of colored paper or confetti thrown during celebrations. A small explosive device that produces a loud noise and bright light when ignited. Lack of good sense; silliness or foolish behavior. A cookie or biscuit shaped like a person, often decorated. Tiny, reflective particles used for decoration. A written request to attend an event or gathering. An expression of approval or enthusiasm. The sound or action of laughing.
A type of candy on a stick. Celebratory and lively activities or festivities. An extraordinary and unexplainable event or phenomenon. A plant often associated with holiday decorations, symbolizing love and friendship. A large-scale show or performance often depicting historical or religious events. A long, thin strip of colorful paper used for decoration. A sudden, sharp sound caused by something bursting or opening quickly. A beverage made by mixing various liquids, often served at parties. A mean and miserly person, usually associated with a character from a famous story. A facial expression that shows happiness or friendliness. A small piece of adhesive paper or plastic with a design on one side. Covered or coated with sugar or a sugary substance. Thin, shiny strips used for decoration, often associated with holiday festivities. A head covering made of artificial hair, often worn for disguise or costume. A circular arrangement of flowers, leaves, or other materials, often used as a decoration.
Easily distracted or forgetful. To be present at or participate in an event or activity. To beat repeatedly, often in cooking. To be the property or possession of. Impudent or cheeky, often in a playful or disrespectful manner. Routine tasks or household duties. To demand as a right or entitlement. To think about or evaluate something carefully. Showing consideration and thoughtfulness towards others. A type of public housing provided by a local government authority. To handle, manage, or address a situation or problem. Able to make decisions quickly and effectively. To declare that something is untrue or incorrect. To disqualify or make ineligible for a certain purpose or competition. Financial assistance provided by the government to those who are unemployed.
To discard or dispose of something, often in a careless manner. To remove or make something no longer full or occupied. Excessive or unnecessary activity, often causing a commotion. Calm, relaxed, and unhurried in attitude or behavior. Allowable or permissible according to rules or standards. Authorization or consent granted to do something. Able to be foreseen or expected due to repetitive patterns. Easily angered or provoked to anger. Waste material or worthless items; garbage or trash. A safety device in a vehicle designed to secure occupants during sudden stops. The ability to control one\'s impulses and emotions. To diminish or harm the quality or value of something. Refusing to change one\'s opinion or course of action despite challenges. To give up, relinquish, or yield to a more powerful force or authority. Excessively proud of one\'s appearance, abilities, or achievements.
To achieve or reach a goal, often after effort or struggle. A device that displays text for a speaker or presenter to read from while on camera. To have a strong dependency on or compulsive need for something. Frequently changing TV channels in a short period of time. A short advertisement with specific information, often in a newspaper or online. A written or printed card used to provide cues or prompts to a speaker or performer. A type of film or television program that combines documentary and drama elements. Providing enjoyment, amusement, or pleasure to an audience. To give someone a legal right or claim to something. To start or introduce something, often a process or activity. A significant or essential piece of information in a discussion or presentation. Live broadcasting or reporting of an event as it happens. To cause a feeling of nausea or disgust. An unexpected and brief news announcement, often interrupting regular programming. Nonsensical or meaningless statements, ideas, or information.
A notice or announcement in a newspaper about a person\'s death. Currently broadcasting or being transmitted on television or radio. To some extent, not completely. To depict or represent someone or something in a particular way. A television program where participants answer questions to win prizes. A measure of the popularity or audience size of a TV show or radio program. Having occurred or happened recently. Closely connected or related to the subject or topic being discussed. An artificial object placed in orbit around the Earth for communication or observation. A person who performs dangerous stunts in movies or television shows. A method of gathering information from a group of people through questions or interviews. To have a tendency or inclination towards a certain behavior or action. To strongly encourage or persuade someone to do something. A person who watches television programs or other visual media. A prediction of the weather conditions for a specific time and place.
To create or develop something based on a particular idea or concept. A sequence in a movie involving a pursuit by vehicles, often involving law enforcement. The group of actors who play roles in a movie, TV show, or play. A famous or well-known person, often from the entertainment industry or public life. A person who goes to watch films at a cinema (movie theater). To establish a connection between different elements or components. To edit or remove certain parts from a film, video, or audio recording. To provide an explanation or detailed account of something using words. To replace the original voices in a film with translated voices in another language. To gradually transition a scene from full visibility to darkness. A full-length movie intended for theatrical release. Recorded visual material used in a film or video. A still image taken from a film or video, often used for emphasis or analysis. The main or leading part played by an actor or actress in a movie or play. The specific place or site where a movie or TV show is filmed.
The primary or most important in terms of significance or size. Of lesser importance or rank compared to something else. To be preoccupied with or excessively focused on something. Actions or events that occur outside the frame of the camera\'s view. The act of making something available to the public, especially a movie or product. To redo a particular scene or shot in a movie or video production. To evaluate, analyze, and express opinions about a movie, book, or performance. The written script of a movie, including dialogue and scene descriptions. A person who writes or develops scripts and screenplays for movies. A film that is shorter in duration than a full-length feature film. The audio component of a film or video, including music, effects, and dialogue. To enhance or add excitement to something, often through creativity or innovation. A feeling of tension, uncertainty, and anticipation created in storytelling. A single instance of recording a scene or sequence in a movie or video. An actor who learns another actor\'s role in a play or movie as a substitute.
To make a public statement about something. An earlier edition of a publication, often a magazine or newspaper. To examine and control information before publication or broadcasting. The total number of copies of a publication that are distributed. A competition or event in which people compete for a prize. False statements that harm someone\'s reputation. To attract attention or interest. A person responsible for overseeing and managing the content of a publication. Visually striking or attention-grabbing. Newspapers and magazines that focus on sensational stories and gossip. A heading at the top of an article or page that introduces the main topic. Comprehensive and thorough coverage or analysis of a subject. A formal conversation between an interviewer and interviewee. To include or engage someone or something in an activity or situation. A place of confinement for people who have been convicted of a crime.
The arrangement and design of visual elements on a page or in a publication. The early edition of a newspaper that is published in the morning. A person who commits the crime of killing another person intentionally. A male journalist or reporter who gathers and presents news stories. A person who reads and corrects errors in written or printed text. A public expression of disagreement or objection towards a specific issue. A company or organization that produces and distributes books, newspapers, or magazines. The collective group of people who regularly read a publication. An organized and often violent opposition or resistance against authority. A device used to receive satellite television broadcasts. Arousing strong interest or attention, often through sensationalism. The main theme or topic of a piece of writing or discussion. Additional or supplementary material that accompanies a publication. A difficult or problematic situation or circumstance. An object used for defense or attack, often intended to cause harm.
Relating to products or practices intended to slow down or reverse the effects of aging. Having no hair on the head. A piece of material used to cover and protect a wound or injury. Treated to become lighter in color, often through chemical processes. Trimmed or cut short, especially in terms of hair. A small natural indentation or dent in the skin, especially on the cheeks or chin. Long, twisted hair strands that are often worn as a hairstyle. To change the color of something, especially hair, using a chemical substance. Complimentary or enhancing in appearance; making someone look better. The part of the face above the eyes and below the hairline. A fringe of hair that hangs over the forehead, often cut straight. Facial hair that is grown on the chin and sometimes extends along the jawline. The particular way in which a person\'s hair is cut and styled. Having well-developed muscles, often due to physical exercise. Tidy and well-organized in appearance or behavior.
A hairstyle that involves treating the hair to create permanent waves or curls. A hairstyle in which the hair is divided into three sections and then braided. A hairstyle in which the hair is gathered and tied at the back of the head. Elegant and luxurious in appearance or style. A sharp-edged tool used for shaving or cutting hair closely. A solution or treatment used to cure or alleviate a health issue or problem. Untidy or messy in appearance. Having a bright and reflective surface. Very thin, often to the point of being unhealthy. Short, coarse facial hair that has grown after shaving. Extremely attractive or impressive in appearance. Having darkened skin tone due to exposure to the sun. Currently fashionable or in vogue. Excessively proud of one\'s appearance or achievements. A small line or fold in the skin, often due to aging or creasing.
To legally take another person\'s child into one\'s family and raise it as one\'s own. To officially approve and put into effect a new law or regulation. An organized effort to promote a specific cause or goal. To carry out or perform a task or action. The use of children in work that is harmful to their development or interferes with their education. The legal and social entitlements of children to receive protection, care, and the opportunity to participate in decisions that affect them. To officially state or announce something publicly. Unfair treatment or unjust behavior based on differences such as race, gender, or age. To completely remove or get rid of something undesirable or harmful. The principle of every individual having the same rights and opportunities without discrimination. A severe shortage of food that leads to widespread hunger and suffering. To engage in a struggle or conflict against something or someone. An adult who cares for and raises a child who is not their biological offspring. The right to express opinions and ideas without censorship or interference. To violate or breach a law, rule, or principle.
The basic rights and freedoms that belong to every person, regardless of their nationality, gender, religion, or other characteristics. A form of protest in which an individual refuses to eat as a way to demand a particular action or change. The state of being self-governing and free from outside control. Criminal behavior committed by minors, usually involving activities that are illegal for their age group. Official consent or authorization to do something. The state of being extremely poor and lacking the means to provide for basic needs. A public demonstration where people march together to show support for or opposition to a cause. The act of making changes to a system, organization, or law in order to improve it. A system in which individuals are treated as property and forced to work without consent. A woman who campaigned for women\'s right to vote, especially in the early 20th century. The state of being without a job, often resulting in financial difficulties. Unable to be justified or defended by reasonable arguments or evidence. The use of physical force to cause harm or damage to people, property, or animals. The formal expression of a person\'s choice in an election or decision-making process. A payment received by a worker for their labor, often calculated on a regular basis.
To gain or obtain something through effort or purchase. A strong desire or determination to achieve something. To increase or improve something, often by adding support or energy. A significant development or discovery, often in a particular field or situation. A person or entity that competes against others, especially in a contest or business. The act of giving or contributing something, often to a cause or project. To reduce or make something smaller in size, quantity, or intensity. To show or illustrate something clearly, often through actions or evidence. To make sure that something happens or is guaranteed to occur. To fail or perform poorly in an examination or task. To manage, deal with, or cope with a situation, task, or challenge. An obstacle or difficulty that must be overcome in order to achieve a goal. To make something better or more satisfactory in quality, value, or condition. To have the intention or plan to do something in the future. To make a mistake or mess of something, causing confusion or disorder.
To watch, observe, or keep track of something over a period of time. An intense preoccupation or fixation on something. To create a general plan or framework of something. To successfully deal with or overcome a difficulty, obstacle, or challenge. To have an exaggerated opinion or estimation of something\'s value or importance. To make ready or organize in advance for a specific purpose or task. The possibilities or opportunities that are likely to arise from a situation. To provide comfort, ease, or relief from pain, stress, or discomfort. To cause severe damage, destruction, or downfall to something. To look or seek for something in a thorough or systematic way. A solution or answer to a problem or challenge. To summarize or provide a concise overview of something. An objective or goal that one intends to achieve. A state of mental or emotional strain, stress, or suspense. The amount of work or tasks that need to be completed.
An unrealistic, fanciful idea or plan that is unlikely to come true. A strong desire or ambition to achieve something. The time of a person\'s life when they are a boy, typically before adolescence. To become exhausted or worn out, especially due to excessive work or stress. To deceive or trick someone by dishonest means. To invent or fabricate something, often a story or explanation. To indulge in a series of pleasant thoughts or fantasies, especially during waking hours. A state of extreme sorrow, pain, or suffering. The period of life when a person is elderly and often experiencing decline in mental faculties. To give special importance or attention to something. Effort to surpass or imitate another, often in achievement or accomplishment. To establish or create something, often a system, organization, or idea. To increase in size, volume, quantity, or scope. The time of a person\'s life when they are a girl, typically before adolescence. The period of greatest strength, success, or popularity of a person or thing.
To put or keep something in a place where it cannot be easily seen or found. Gray or white with age; ancient. To regard or represent as perfect or better than in reality. Not in harmony or keeping with the surroundings or other aspects of something. The period during which a person is alive. An important event or stage in the development or progress of something. To make a prolonged, low sound expressing physical or emotional pain. A frightening or unpleasant dream or experience. An unrealistic or unattainable goal or dream. Serious thought or consideration. A state of being pleasantly lost in one\'s thoughts; a daydream. Of or relating to older people, especially those who are retired or nearing retirement. To form a theory or conjecture about a subject without firm evidence. To gaze at or contemplate the stars in the sky, often with a sense of wonder. A drop of clear salty liquid secreted by glands in your eyes.
To offer advice or counsel to someone; to recommend a course of action. An assumed name, especially as used to hide one\'s identity; a pseudonym. To express regret or remorse for an action, statement, or behavior. Something that is advantageous or good; a helpful or favorable effect. To assign responsibility for a fault or wrong; to hold accountable. An employee of the government, typically in a role related to administrative duties. To state that something is true or exists, often without providing evidence or proof. To acknowledge the truth or validity of something, often after initially denying it. To deliberately leave out or exclude someone or something. A top-level manager or leader in an organization or company. To make something clear or understandable by providing information or details. In a position of authority or responsibility; responsible for overseeing something. To assert or demand forcefully or persistently; to state with confidence. To be in a state of low spirits; to feel gloomy or dejected. To move one\'s head up and down as a gesture of agreement or acknowledgement.
To compel or require someone to do something. A casual or occasional task. To convince or persuade someone to do or believe something. To indicate or bring attention to something specific. To make a commitment to do something in the future. To strongly express disagreement or objection. To repeat the exact words that someone else has said. To propose or recommend something to someone. Excess or surplus, not necessary. To remind someone of something; to jog one\'s memory. To voluntarily leave a job or position, often formally. To dismiss someone from a job or position. To suggest or propose an idea or solution. To reject or decline an offer, request, or proposal. To give a cautionary or advance notice of potential danger or trouble.
To become visible or present; to come into sight. To reassure or make someone confident about something. To earnestly request or implore someone for something. To accept something as true without certain proof. In a clear or obvious manner; without confusion. In a conceivable or possible way; within the realm of imagination. To relate to or be of interest or importance to someone. To verify or acknowledge the accuracy or truth of something. To persuade someone to believe or do something through reasoning or argument. To express disapproval or judgement of something or someone. To formally announce or state something clearly and explicitly. To forcefully ask for or insist on something as a right. To merit or be worthy of a particular reaction, reward, or treatment. To give support, confidence, or hope to someone to do something. To prohibit or forbid someone from doing something.
To make an educated assumption or estimation. To provide information or details to someone. To give instructions or guidance to someone. To determine the size, quantity, or degree of something. To mention or refer to something in speech or writing. To formally communicate or give notice to someone. To give a direct command or directive. To suggest or put forward a plan or idea for consideration. To engage in a heated argument or dispute. To provide comfort, confidence, or certainty to someone. To give a detailed account or statement of something. To make a loud, high-pitched sound or cry. To give the impression or appear in a particular way. Without doubt or question; certainly. To strongly recommend or encourage someone to do something.
A small, flat case used for carrying documents, usually with a handle. A type of retail store where customers can purchase items in bulk without the need for a membership. A retail store that is part of a larger group or franchise and operates under the same brand. A piece of meat, typically beaten and flattened before cooking.
